Posts.Content: scribedaily wrote: Hello.  My stereo biopsy is tomorrow and after all this waiting I am at my wits end.  I was wondering if any of you that have been DX'd with cancer (DCIS or other) had an initial radiology report that stated "clustered heterogeneous and punctate micrcocalcifications."  I cannot find anything that relates to these specific characteristics and am curious if they are more indicative that I might not get a great biopsy result. Thank you all SO much. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Clustered heterogeneous and punctate microcalc? scribedaily leaf

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2009 06:08PM scribedaily wrote: Thank you so much, leaf.  According to this sight, DCIS should be suspected with the description of my microcalcifications, which is what I was thinking all along that they would say because of prior research.  I had not seen this site before, so thank you for directing it to me.
Posts.Title: Clustered heterogeneous and punctate microcalc? scribedaily leaf
